Clause: I've been involved with the MIME charset issue for a long time
that I am one of the authors of the ISO-2022-JP spec).
In defense of the other Pine team members, the sin is one of omission rather than of comission;
they wanted to do something about character sets
and didn't want to wire in a table of legal values
that as a first pass the charset should only be settable in the system config file,
and that the charset always be coerced to US-ASCII
8-bit characters and/or has ``funny'' control characters such as ESC or SI/SO.
More work would definitely be needed in this area,
that there are other, higher priorities just now...
